subject: Education
subcategory: Great Teachers Who Changed the World
title: Rudolf Steiner: The Mystic Who Built Schools
description: A micro-lesson that makes Rudolf Steiner: The Mystic Who Built Schools usable.

hook.text: Rudolf Steiner was a philosopher who believed in reincarnation, talked to spirits, and founded 1,200 schools.

buildup.text: In 1919, a cigarette factory owner asked Steiner to create a school for workers' children. Waldorf education was born.

discovery.text: Steiner designed a curriculum around art, rhythm, and imagination. Children knit, paint, and garden before they read.

twist.text: His spiritual ideas were eccentric, even troubling. But his educational instincts about childhood development were

climax.text: Steiner proved that a deeply strange thinker can still create something beautiful. His schools outlived his philosophy.

punchline.text: The mystic got childhood right. Nobody expected that.

quiz.question: What was the original context for the first Waldorf school?
options: A school for factory workers' children
